dmca.title: Notice of Infringement
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: Donna's Holiday Sentiments [mailto:donna@donnasholidaysentiments.com] 
Sent: Monday, February 28, 2005 11:57 AM
To: copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: Notice of Infringement

I am writing in regard to the unauthorized use of my copyrighted poems on
someone else's web site.  I have emailed the site's owner, but they have not
responded or compied. The material in question appears on the following page
of
their site: http://honeybrain.com/honey.asp?id=parents and reads as follows:

=======

"When I was young, you helped me grow,
And taught me all I had to know
Of love and trust and faith and hope,
And everything it takes to cope.
You may have thought I didn't hear,
Or maybe that you weren't quite clear;
But all the things you taught to me
Were heeded very carefully,
And now I want to thank you for
Your love, your care, and so much more!

What would my life be without you?
I'd never have made it this far.
You've helped me through all my endeavors;
You're the best! You're a peach! You're Genius!

What a joy to have someone as wonderful as you,
Who offers such concern and care in everything I do,
Who's always there to lend an ear to anything I say;
God bless you..."

=====

The poems in questions can be viewed on this page of my site:
http://www.donnasholidaysentiments.com/mompoems.html.

I am with good faith belief that use the of the material in the manner
complained of is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the
law.
As the owner of the copyright, I declare, under penalty of perjury, that the
above information in my Notice is accurate.

Thank you,

/Donna Sheehan/
Donna Sheehan
